lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/darren_bot.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run darren_bot.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

* Utility class that translates raw user input strings into structured commands
* and arguments that the application can understand.

*
  • Identifying the command type (e.g., {@code todo}, {@code deadline}, {@code event}, etc.).
*   <li>Extracting any additional arguments required by that command,
* such as task descriptions, deadlines, or date ranges.

*
  • Throwing {@link EmptyTaskException} when user input is incomplete or invalid.
* Parses a raw line of user input and maps it to a supported {@link Command}.
* @return the {@link Command} that corresponds to the input; returns
*         {@link Command#UNKNOWN} if the input is blank or does not match any known command
* Extracts arguments from a user input line according to the command type.

*
  • Index values for {@code mark}, {@code unmark}, and {@code delete}.
* @param cmd  the command type previously identified
* @param line the full user input line
* @return a {@link ParsedArgs} instance containing extracted values
* @throws EmptyTaskException if the input is missing required arguments
*                            or if the deadline format is invalid
public static ParsedArgs parseArgs(Command cmd, String line) throws EmptyTaskException {

* Represents the set of supported command types that the {@code Parser} can

*

Each constant corresponds to a specific action that the bot can execute.
public enum Command { BYE, LIST, MARK, UNMARK, DEADLINE, TODO, EVENT, DELETE, FIND, UNKNOWN }
* Container class for arguments extracted from user input.
* Provides factory methods to create different types of parsed arguments,
/** Task index, used for mark/unmark/delete commands. */
/** Start time string, used for event. */
/** End time string, used for event. */
public static ParsedArgs none() { return new ParsedArgs(); }
/** Creates {@link ParsedArgs} with an index argument. */
public static ParsedArgs index(int i) { ParsedArgs a = new ParsedArgs(); a.index = i; return a; }
/** Creates {@link ParsedArgs} for a todo with a description. */
public static ParsedArgs todo(String d) { ParsedArgs a = new ParsedArgs(); a.desc = d; return a; }
/** Creates {@link ParsedArgs} for a deadline with description and date. */
public static ParsedArgs deadline(String d, java.time.LocalDate by) { ParsedArgs a = new ParsedArgs(); a.desc = d; a.by = by; return a; }
/** Creates {@link ParsedArgs} for an event with description and time range. */
public static ParsedArgs event(String d, String from, String to) { ParsedArgs a = new ParsedArgs(); a.desc = d; a.from = from; a.to = to; return a; }
public static ParsedArgs find(String keyword) { ParsedArgs a = new ParsedArgs(); a.findKeyword = keyword; return a; }
* Handles reading from and writing to the storage file that persists user tasks.
* The {@code Storage} class is responsible for:

*
  • Ensuring that the data directory and file exist before use.

*
  • Loading saved tasks from the file into memory as a {@link TaskList}.

*
  • Appending new tasks to the file when they are added.

*
  • Rewriting the entire file to reflect updates such as deletes or marks/unmarks.
* Constructs a new {@code Storage} instance pointing to the given file path.
* @param filePath the file path where tasks should be stored and loaded from
* Ensures that the data file exists.
* Creates the parent directories if they do not exist,
* and creates the data file itself if it does not already exist.
* @throws IOException if the directories or file cannot be created

* Parses each line in the file and reconstructs the appropriate
* restoring their completion status as recorded.
* @return a {@code TaskList} containing all tasks found in the file
* @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs while reading the file
* @throws UnexpectedCommandException if a line in the file does not match a known task type
public TaskList load() throws IOException, UnexpectedCommandException {

assertEquals("[T][ ] sleep later", new Todo("sleep later").toString());
